files.title: Organizes parameters on input data files.

peaktable.title: File containing information of peaks (=molecular features)

filepath.title: Specifies the filepath. Absolute paths are preferred.

format.title: Specifies the format of the file. Must be one of the allowed formats in 'enum'.

polarity.title: Specifies the polarity of the peaktable file. Must be one of the allowed formats in 'enum'.

msms.title: (Optional): file containing information of MS/MS spectra of molecular features in peaktable.

filepath.title: Specifies the filepath. Absolute paths are preferred.

format.title: Specifies the format of the file. Must be one of the allowed formats in 'enum'.

rel_int_from.title: (Optional): Specifies minimal relative intensity of fragments to be retained. Must be a value between (and including) 0 and 1.0.

phenotype.title: (Optional): file containing phenotype information. 'Format' requires respective 'phenotype_assignment' settings below.

filepath.title: Specifies the filepath. Absolute paths are preferred.

format.title: Specifies the format of the file. Must be one of the allowed formats in 'enum'.

group_metadata.title: (Optional): file containing information on group metadata information.

filepath.title: Specifies the filepath. Absolute paths are preferred.

format.title: Specifies the format of the file. Must be one of the allowed formats in 'enum'.

spectral_library.title: (Optional): file containing a custom spectral library for spectra similarity matching.

filepath.title: Specifies the filepath. Absolute paths are preferred.

format.title: Specifies the format of the file. Must be one of the allowed formats in 'enum'.

ms2query_results.title: (Optional): file containing MS2Query results. Must contain a column 'id' that matches feature IDs from peaktable. If present, MS2Query algorithm does not run.

filepath.title: Specifies the filepath. Absolute paths are preferred.

score_cutoff.title: (Optional): minimum score to consider feature annotation.

directory_path.title: Specifies the directory path. Absolute paths are preferred.

similarity_cutoff.title: (Optional): minimum gene cluster similarity to MIBiG matches to consider in analysis, as fraction. A value of 0.7 indicates that 70% or more genes of a MIBiG entry must be shared by the query to consider a KnownClusterBlast match.

core_modules.title: Modules that are executed by default. If not desired, they need to be deactivated explicitly, else they will run with default settings.

adduct_annotation.title: (Optional): settings for adduct annotation of molecular features.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

mass_dev_ppm.title: (Optional): expected mass deviation tolerance in parts per million.

neutral_loss_annotation.title: (Optional): settings for neutral loss annotation of MS/MS fragments.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

mass_dev_ppm.title: (Optional): expected mass deviation tolerance in parts per million.

nonbiological.title: (Optional): Specifies whether neutral losses should be compared to losses originating from synthetic molecules.

fragment_annotation.title: (Optional): settings for fragment annotation of MS/MS fragments.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

mass_dev_ppm.title: (Optional): expected mass deviation tolerance in parts per million.

spec_sim_networking.title: (Optional): settings for spectral similarity networking (='molecular networking') with one or more algorithms.

modified_cosine.title: (Optional): modified cosine algorithm. Most commonly used, quantifies the similarity between two spectra based on their dot-product. See 'https://matchms.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/matchms.similarity.ModifiedCosine.html' for details.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

msms_min_frag_nr.title: (Optional): minimum number of fragments a MS/MS fragmentation spectrum must have to be considered in spectral similarity networking. Spectra with a low number of fragments may lead to unspecific matching and so-called 'hairball clusters'.

fragment_tol.title: (Optional): tolerance for matching two MS/MS fragments, in m/z units.

score_cutoff.title: (Optional): minimum modified cosine score that must be reached to consider two MS/MS fragmentation spectra to be related.

max_nr_links.title: (Optional): max. number of links to other molecular features any molecular feature is allowed to have.

maximum_runtime.title: (Optional): maximum running time of module, in seconds. A value of 0 (zero) indicates unlimited running time.

ms2deepscore.title: (Optional): MS2Deepscore algorithm. Quantifies the similarity between two spectra based on a spectral embedding (deep learning). Only works fot positive ion mode data. See 'https://github.com/matchms/ms2deepscore' for details.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

score_cutoff.title: (Optional): minimum score that must be reached to consider two MS/MS fragmentation spectra to be related.

max_nr_links.title: (Optional): max. number of links to other molecular features any molecular feature is allowed to have.

msms_min_frag_nr.title: (Optional): minimum number of fragments a MS/MS fragmentation spectrum must have to be considered in spectral similarity networking. Spectra with a low number of fragments may lead to unspecific matching and so-called 'hairball clusters'.

maximum_runtime.title: (Optional): maximum running time of module, in seconds. A value of 0 (zero) indicates unlimited running time.

additional_modules.title: (Optional): modules that are not executed by default and need to be activated explicitly. If not specified, the modules will be skipped.

feature_filtering.title: (Optional): molecular feature filtering. If not specified, this module will be skipped.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

filter_rel_int_range.title: (Optional): restrict data analysis to molecular features that have a relative intensity (intensity relative to the highest feature intensity per sample) that is inside the specified range. If a feature is detected in multiple samples, at least one occurrence must be inside the specified range. Else, the feature is not considered.

filter_rel_area_range.title: (Optional): restrict data analysis to molecular features that have a relative area (area relative to the highest feature area per sample that is inside the specified range. If a feature is detected in multiple samples, at least one occurrence must be inside the specified range. Else, the feature is not considered.

blank_assignment.title: (Optional): settings for sample blank determination (subtraction). Is only executed if a 'group_metadata' file is provided and sample BLANKS are declared.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

factor.title: (Optional): factor to determine subtraction of features detected in both blank and non-blank samples. Feature value (height or area) be n-times higher across samples than across blanks (determined by 'algorithm') to not be considered blank.

algorithm.title: (Optional): Algorithm to summarize value over samples/blanks.

value.title: (Optional): Specifies which value type should be considered.

group_factor_assignment.title: (Optional): settings for group factor assignment (fold change between groups). Is only executed if a 'group_metadata' file is provided.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

algorithm.title: (Optional): Algorithm to summarize value over samples/blanks.

value.title: (Optional): Specifies which value type should be considered.

phenotype_assignment.title: (Optional): settings for determination of phenotype-associated molecular features. Is only executed if a 'phenotype' file is provided.

qualitative.title: Fold-difference algorithm. Molecular features are binned into activity-associated and -non-associated based on factor (fold difference) between active/inactive samples.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

factor.title: (Optional): factor difference to be used for molecular feature differentiation.

algorithm.title: (Optional): Algorithm to summarize value over active/inactive samples.

value.title: (Optional): Specifies which value type should be considered.

quantitative-percentage.title: Pearson correlation of percentage activity per sample with molecular feature area per sample.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

sample_avg.title: (Optional): Specifies algorithm to summarize multiple measurements per sample for same assay.

value.title: (Optional): Specifies which value type should be considered.

algorithm.title: (Optional): Specifies the statistical algorithm to use.

p_val_cutoff.title: (Optional): Minimum Bonferroni-corrected p-value to consider. A value of zero disables the cutoff filtering (automatically applies to both score and p-value).

coeff_cutoff.title: (Optional): Minimum correlation coefficient to consider. A value of zero disables the cutoff filtering (automatically applies to both score and p-value).

quantitative-concentration.title: Pearson correlation of minimum active concentration per sample with molecular feature area per sample.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

sample_avg.title: (Optional): Specifies algorithm to summarize multiple measurrments per sample for same assay.

value.title: (Optional): Specifies which value type should be considered.

algorithm.title: (Optional): Specifies the statistical algorithm to use.

p_val_cutoff.title: (Optional): Minimum Bonferroni-corrected p-value to consider. A value of zero disables the cutoff filtering (automatically applies to both score and p-value).

coeff_cutoff.title: (Optional): Minimum correlation coefficient to consider. A value of zero disables the cutoff filtering (automatically applies to both score and p-value).

spectral_library_matching.title: (Optional): settings for spectral library matching. Will be only executed if a 'spectral_library' file was provided.

modified_cosine.title: (Optional): modified cosine algorithm. Most commonly used, quantifies the similarity between two spectra based on their dot-product. See 'https://matchms.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/matchms.similarity.ModifiedCosine.html' for details.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

fragment_tol.title: (Optional): tolerance for matching two MS/MS fragments, in m/z units.

min_nr_matched_peaks.title: (Optional): minimum number of fragments that must be matched between two MS/MS fragmentation spectra to consider two spectra related.

score_cutoff.title: (Optional): minimum modified cosine score that must be reached to consider two MS/MS fragmentation spectra to be related.

max_precursor_mass_diff.title: (Optional): maximum difference between the precursor masses of two MS/MS spectra, in m/z units. A high number may lead to serendipitous matching between unrelated spectra, while a low number may exclude possible analogues.

maximum_runtime.title: (Optional): maximum running time of module, in seconds. A value of 0 (zero) indicates unlimited running time.

ms2deepscore.title: (Optional): MS2Deepscore algorithm. Quantifies the similarity between two spectra based on a spectral embedding (deep learning). See 'https://github.com/matchms/ms2deepscore' for details.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

score_cutoff.title: (Optional): minimum score that must be reached to consider two MS/MS fragmentation spectra to be related.

max_precursor_mass_diff.title: (Optional): maximum difference between the precursor masses of two MS/MS spectra, in m/z units. A high number may lead to serendipitous matching between unrelated spectra, while a low number may exclude possible analogues.

maximum_runtime.title: (Optional): maximum running time of module, in seconds. A value of 0 (zero) indicates unlimited running time.

ms2query_annotation.title: (Optional): settings for MS2Query annotation module. For non-specified parameters, default parameters will be used.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

maximum_runtime.title: (Optional): maximum running time of module, in seconds. A value of 0 (zero) indicates unlimited running time.

score_cutoff.title: (Optional): minimum score that must be reached to consider two MS/MS fragmentation spectra to be related.

as_kcb_matching.title: (Optional): settings for antiSMASH KnownClusterBlast results matching. Will be only executed if a 'as_results' directory was provided.

modified_cosine.title: (Optional): modified cosine algorithm. Most commonly used, quantifies the similarity between two spectra based on their dot-product. See 'https://matchms.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/matchms.similarity.ModifiedCosine.html' for details.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

fragment_tol.title: (Optional): tolerance for matching two MS/MS fragments, in m/z units.

min_nr_matched_peaks.title: (Optional): minimum number of fragments that must be matched between two MS/MS fragmentation spectra to consider two spectra related.

score_cutoff.title: (Optional): minimum modified cosine score that must be reached to consider two MS/MS fragmentation spectra to be related.

max_precursor_mass_diff.title: (Optional): maximum difference between the precursor masses of two MS/MS spectra, in m/z units. A high number may lead to serendipitous matching between unrelated spectra, while a low number may exclude possible analogues.

maximum_runtime.title: (Optional): maximum running time of module, in seconds. A value of 0 (zero) indicates unlimited running time.

ms2deepscore.title: (Optional): MS2Deepscore algorithm. Quantifies the similarity between two spectra based on a spectral embedding (deep learning). See 'https://github.com/matchms/ms2deepscore' for details.

activate_module.title: Specifies whether this module should be run.

score_cutoff.title: (Optional): minimum score that must be reached to consider two MS/MS fragmentation spectra to be related.

max_precursor_mass_diff.title: (Optional): maximum difference between the precursor masses of two MS/MS spectra, in m/z units. A high number may lead to serendipitous matching between unrelated spectra, while a low number may exclude possible analogues.

maximum_runtime.title: (Optional): maximum running time of module, in seconds. A value of 0 (zero) indicates unlimited running time.
